articles.title: CPRK Denounces Lee Myung Bak's Provocative Remarks against DPRK
articles.content:
CPRK Denounces Lee Myung Bak's Provocative Remarks against DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Committee for the Peaceful Reunification of Korea gave an answer to a question put by KCNA Wednesday as regards the provocative remarks made by traitor Lee Myung Bak against the DPRK during his recent visit to Germany.
					 On May 8 Lee at the round-table talks with compatriots and a press conference held during his junket to Germany, the first leg of his European tour, blustered that the north's nukes are obstructive to unification, urging it to "dismantle" them, and asserted that it should "apologize" for the warship sinking case and the Yonphyong Island shelling case. He went the lengths of crying out for "the punishment of what he called "provocation" as regards even the anti-DPRK conspiratorial case orchestrated by him in the past.
					
					 He groundlessly pointed an accusing finger at the DPRK, finding fault with its system. He also let loose a string of foolish invectives inciting despicable confrontation of systems, talking about the pull-down of the Berlin Wall. 
					
					 The spokesman branded this as a blatant provocation against the system and dignity of the DPRK and an intolerable mockery of the public opinion at home and abroad and the DPRK's positive efforts for dialogue.
					
					  He went on: Lee, not content with kicking off the anti-reunification confrontation racket in south Korea, made such reckless remarks overseas. This was nothing but the last-ditch effort to chill the ever-growing atmosphere of dialogue, ward off the criticism of him for the collapse of the inter-Korean relations and the failure of his policy toward the north and justify his anti-DPRK nuclear racket and the moves to escalate the confrontation with it.
					
					 The puppet group was so preposterous as to describe the DPRK's "apology" for the above-said two cases as an option for crossing the threshold of inter-Korean dialogue. This revealed its ulterior intention to challenge the DPRK to the end, without having any dialogue with it. The group's outbursts raising someone's "dismantlement of nukes" as a precondition for dialogue are no more than a ridiculous attempt to disarm the DPRK and realize the ambition for invading it in collusion with the U.S.
					
					 The group is seeking to import the mode of reunification applied by a foreign country, bewildered by it. This is as foolish an act as expecting the sky to fall.
					
					 The Korean Peninsula is not Germany.
					
					 The puppet group is dreaming of such a contingency as what happened in Germany but it was south Korea where regimes collapsed several times due to such contingencies as the April 19 Popular Uprising that broke out on the peninsula.
					
					 Great irony is that Lee, a stooge serving the U.S. in its moves for a nuclear war, is going busy with hectic diplomacy over the issue of opening what he called a nuclear summit in south Korea, the world's biggest advanced base for a nuclear war and largest nuclear arsenal. 
					
					 The world people still remember well that he declared the policy of toeing the U.S. and the policy of confrontation with fellow countrymen when he was coming to power and blustered that it was all right not to have inter-Korean dialogue during the tenure of his office. 
					
					 The DPRK cannot but seriously consider its stance maintained so far as it has become clear now that the mean declaration made by Lee was put into practice and he is set to stand in confrontation to the last.
					
					 It is quite self-evident that nothing can be expected from a dialogue with such a man keen on confrontation with fellow countrymen, blinded by a foolish dream.
					
					 The DPRK will never pardon those hurting its dignity and system and making a mockery of them but take merciless and strong counter-actions against them.
					
					 The confrontation of the systems will only lead to a war.
					
					 If a war breaks out on this land, it will be the Korean nation's just and sacred patriotic war for national reunification.
					
					  Lee would be well advised to behave himself, properly understanding the disposition of the DPRK and the reality.

articles.title: Pak Ui Chun Sends Congratulatory Message to Nepal FM
articles.content:
Pak Ui Chun Sends Congratulatory Message to Nepal FM
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Pak Ui Chun Tuesday sent a congratulatory message to Upendra Yadav upon his appointment as deputy prime minister and concurrently foreign minister of Nepal.
					 The message expressed belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to develop in the future, too, and wished him success in his new job.

articles.title: Chinese Defense Minister on Boosting Sino-DPRK Friendship
articles.content:
Chinese Defense Minister on Boosting Sino-DPRK Friendship
						
Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- DPRK Ambassador to China Ji Jae Ryong on Monday paid a courtesy call on Liang Guanglie, state councilor and minister of National Defense of China.
					 The minister recollected with deep emotion the days of his visit to the DPRK. The Sino-DPRK friendship is the traditional friendship personally provided by the revolutionaries of the elder generation of China including Chairman Mao Zedong and President Kim Il Sung and the militant friendship which was sealed in blood and stood the test, he said, stressing the need to set greater store by this common treasure.
					
					 He went on:
					
					 The Sino-DPRK relations are the relationship in which the two peoples respected and trusted, positively supported and cooperated with each other not only in the wartime but in the peacetime. The Chinese people fought alongside the Korean people against the U.S. imperialists' aggression.
					
					 In recent years the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries have steadily grown stronger and the two armies have made positive contributions to promoting the development of their countries and protecting the common interests of the two sides and regional peace and stability, he said.
					
					 Many successes have been registered in cooperation, visits and in other aspects between the two armies under the care of General Secretary Hu Jintao and General Secretary Kim Jong Il, he noted, reiterating the will to boost them.

articles.title: Rice Transplanting Starts in Wonhwa-ri
articles.content:
Rice Transplanting Starts in Wonhwa-ri
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Rice transplanting started at the Wonhwa Cooperative Farm, Phyongwon County, South Phyongan Province of the DPRK.
					The farm registered President Kim Il Sung and General Secretary Kim Jong Il as its honorary members. The President visited Wonhwa-ri on May 10, Juche 41 (1952) when the Fatherland Liberation War was at its height. He joined peasants there in sowing seeds, opening a prospect for agricultural cooperativization. The farm kicked off the rice transplantation this year, greeting the significant day.
					
					 The officials and other members of the farm sowed rice seeds in the right time and made great efforts for tending rice-seedling beds to raise healthy seedlings despite the unprecedented unfavorable weather.
					
					 The rice transplantation is making brisk headway from its very start as it was kicked off on the basis of full preparations including the overhaul of tractors and other farm machines.

articles.title: New Species of Cucumber Bred
articles.content:
New Species of Cucumber Bred 
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- A high-yielding species of cucumber is growing at the hydroponic greenhouse of the Pyongyang Vegetable Science Institute. 
					 The species is strong in resistance to epidemics and grows well even in low temperature and with a little amount of sunshine.
					
					 It was bred by Ryang Min Ho, a section chief of the institute.
					
					 He also succeeded in breeding new species of cucumber which can be cultivated in any season.
					
					 He got patents and diplomas for new inventions and technologies concerning vegetable cultivation.
					
					 When visiting the institute some time ago, leader Kim Jong Il praised its scientists and technicians as patriots.

articles.title: CAD Applied to Garment Factories
articles.content:
CAD Applied to Garment Factories
						
Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- A CAD (computer-aided design) program developed by Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry has been applied to the Aeguk Moran and other garment factories.
					 The program produces different manikins in a three-dimensional way and design clothes suitable for them in a short time.
					
					 It also chooses quality and color of materials and pattern and decoration of clothes.
					
					 It reduces labor by half, while economizing materials.

articles.title: Revolutionary Hymn "The Star of Korea"
articles.content:
Revolutionary Hymn "The Star of Korea"
						
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- "The Star of Korea" is the first revolutionary hymn created in Korea in praise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 It was written and composed by Kim Hyok, a revolutionary poet, in Juche 17 (1928) when the anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle was in its early period.
					
					 The song reflects the deep reverence of young revolutionaries and other Korean people for Kim Il Sung, who started revolutionary activities for national liberation in his early years, as the sun of the nation and the centre of unity.
					
					 With the approach of the 6th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea, the song was known to the public.
					
					 At that time, the feature film "The Star of Korea" was released and the song was widely introduced by mass media.

articles.title: Japanese Reactionaries' Disgusting Behavior Ridiculed
articles.content:
Japanese Reactionaries' Disgusting Behavior Ridiculed
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Shortly ago, the U.S. newspaper Wall Street Journal carried an article and map properly calling Tok Islets and the East Sea of Korea. 
					 No sooner had this report been released than the Japanese government dismissed this "unacceptable," describing it as something serious. It made much fuss, lodging a protest with Dow-Jones Company publishing the above-said newspaper.
					
					  Rodong Sinmun Wednesday observes in a by-lined commentary in this regard:
					
					  What the Japanese government claimed is a nonsensical and far-fetched assertion. 
					
					  It goes on:
					
					  Since olden times Tok Islets have been part of the territory of Korea and the sea between Korea and Japan has been called the East Sea of Korea.
					
					  The above-said facts are mentioned not only in historic documents of Korea but in most maps made by EU and U.S. scholars after the middle age.
					
					  This is quite natural in the light of international practice that any island can be designated on the principle of occupying ownerless land before any others in the world and a sea should be called by the name of the country on which it is bounded.  
					
					  The above-said protest made by the Japanese government is a revelation of shameless nature and deep-seated bad habit peculiar to Japan.
					
					  This goes to prove that Japan's militarist ambition to grab other's territory has gone beyond the tolerance limit.
					
					  The above-mentioned protest of Japan is no more than a reckless militarist action and disgraceful behavior prompted by its sinister intention to convince the international community that Tok Islets belong to the country and there exists only the "Sea of Japan," not the East Sea of Korea.
					
					  Japan is making desperate efforts to deprive Korea of the names of Tok Islets and the East Sea of Korea in disregard of stark historical facts and international practice and principle concerning dominion over the island and the designation of sea. This is a repetition of the Japanese imperialists' invasion of Korea in the first half of the last century.
					
					  Japan would be well advised to properly understand the changed times and the world people's mindset and stop going reckless.

articles.title: Papers Call for Strong Support to Countryside
articles.content:
Papers Call for Strong Support to Countryside
Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Leading papers Wednesday editorially call for strong support to the countryside. 
					 Rodong Sinmun appeals to the whole party, the whole country and all people to turn out as one in the drive to wind up the rice transplantation qualitatively in right time in hearty response to the call of the Workers' Party of Korea for bringing about a signal improvement in the standard of people's living. 
					
					 The daily goes on:
					
					 The party requires the agricultural working people to bring about great innovations and a great leap forward in agricultural production by learning from the spirit and traits displayed by the preceding generations. 
					
					 They can do anything in the world if they work in the same indomitable fighting spirit as displayed by the people of the Xiaowangqing Guerrilla Zone in tilling fields and sowing seeds there to send food to guerillas, while fighting bloody battles during the period of the anti-Japanese armed struggle. 
					
					 They should bring about miracles and innovations in the rice-transplanting campaign by learning from the work style of the patriotic peasants who ensured increased food production in wartime under the banner of the slogan "The Rear Is, as It Were, the Front!" They should, at the same time, bring about collective innovations in the rice-transplanting campaign by helping and leading each other along under the slogan "One for All and All for One!"
					
					 All fields and units of the national economy should unconditionally provide on top priority manpower, equipment and farm materials needed for the campaign on the principle of subordinating everything to farming. 
					
					 Minju Joson calls for focusing all efforts and mobilizing everything for the drive to help the farmers in their efforts to effect signal innovations in agricultural production this year, true to the Songun leadership of the WPK.

articles.title: US Concerned about Disclosure of US-Japan Secret Pacts on Nuclear Arms
articles.content:
US Concerned about Disclosure of US-Japan Secret Pacts on Nuclear Arms 
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- It was confirmed that the U.S. repeatedly expressed concern about the disclosure of the U.S.-Japan secret pacts on nuclear arms. 
					 The Japanese Asahi Shimbun on May 7 said in an article titled "Secret Pacts on Nuclear Arms Disclosed. Concern Repeatedly Expressed about DPJ-led Government":
					
					 When the government led by the Democratic Party of Japan in March last year declassified the contents of the U.S.-Japan secret pacts on nuclear arms signed during the revision of the Japan-U.S. Security Treaty in 1960, the U.S. side repeatedly expressed strong concern that it might affect the U.S. world strategy. This fact was known in the course of analyzing the diplomatic cable on Japan disclosed by WikiLeaks. 
					
					 The secret pacts which allowed the port calls of the U.S. warships carrying nukes had been considered invalid as the U.S. forces suspended the transport of nuclear weapons by their vessels in 1991 after the demise of the Cold War era. 
					
					 However, this diplomatic cable vividly reveals the ulterior intention of the U.S. side to steadily inherit "a tacit agreement" as it raised the possibility that there would be a policy change in the future. It is inevitable that it is bound to contradict the three non-nuclear principles of Japan banning the introduction of nuclear weapons into Japan. 
					
					 According to the diplomatic cable to the U.S. State Department from the U.S. embassy in Tokyo on November 27, 2009, the issue of handling the secret pacts was discussed between the U.S. senior minister and Umemoto, director of the North American Affairs Department of the Foreign Ministry of Japan, at the U.S. embassy that day. 
					
					 The senior minister said that it was an important element of the deterrence strategy to make nuke shipping ambiguous and Ambassador Roos is concerned about the direction of the investigation, he said, adding that this was not a simple internal matter but it is likely to affect the U.S. strategy in the light of its impact on a broader global scale.
					
					 Umemoto expressed understanding of the concern expressed by the U.S. side, saying that it is a troublesome problem and it would be more difficult than the Futenma issue. The present Hatoyama government seems not to understand the consequences to be entailed by the investigation into the secret pacts, he noted, underscoring the need to further the unofficial consultation between Japan and the U.S. over the issue of how to respond to the voices demanding a more explicit clarification of nuclear weapons. 
					
					 According to a diplomatic message from Tokyo on February 4, 2010, two months later, the secret pacts became the topic of discussion during the talks held between Campbell, assistant secretary of State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs, and others and Umemoto and others. 
					
					 Campbell cited "extended deterrence" and "historical problems surrounding nukes" as the tasks facing Japan and the U.S., stressing the need to make it possible for the U.S. aircraft and warships to enter Japan irrespective of whether they carry nuclear weapons or not. 
					
					 All facts go to prove that the U.S.-Japan secret pacts on nuclear arms were not a document valid only in the past but has remained in force for a long period.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Warmongers Plan to Stage Ground Coordinated Drill
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Warmongers Plan to Stage Ground Coordinated Drill
						
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- The 65th Division of the south Korean puppet army is planning to stage large-scale ground coordinated drill in Uijongbu and Yangju areas of Kyonggi Province from May 11 to 13, according to south Korean Yonhap News.
					 The warmongers seek to mobilize in the drill the police, reserve forces and government employees as well as military troops.
					
					 They are staging military exercises for aggression on the DPRK under the simulated condition of someone's "intrusion" almost every day, inciting bitterness toward it and war fever.

articles.title: Authorities' Reshuffle Criticized in S. Korea
articles.content:
Authorities' Reshuffle Criticized in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Democratic Labor Party of south Korea on May 6 issued a commentary criticizing the puppet authorities' deceptive cabinet reshuffle.
					 Noting that Chongwadae announced the results of reshuffle that day, the commentary charged that the authorities let those responsible for the administration failure, including the director of the Intelligence Service and the minister of Unification, stay in office, thus turning aside the public sentiment shown in the April 27 by-election.
					
					 The person, designated as minister of Planning and Finance, in particular, has come under bitter criticism by the labor circle for his full support to the present "government's" anti-worker and pro-big business policy, it pointed out, saying:
					
					Such designation cannot be construed otherwise than an intention to keep the policy of ignoring the people's livelihood and favoring big businessmen.

articles.title: Repression of Youth and Students Flayed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Repression of Youth and Students Flayed in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification on May 6 issued a statement titled "We will certainly punish Lee Myung Bak and security forces."
					 The statement strongly denounced the security forces for their fascist suppression of the Youth and Students Solidarity for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration on May 4.
					
					 The security forces are cracking down on the organization on charges of the violation of the "National Security Law" for the reason that it had contact with the north side for implementation of the south-north joint declarations in the past, the statement noted.
					
					 The harsh fascist suppression will never break the popular masses' aspiration and will for independence, democracy and reunification, and their spirit will further gain in strength, it said, adding:
					
					 We will wage a more vigorous struggle to have the present "government" resigned, the "Grand National Party" dissolved and the fascist mechanism abolished.

articles.title: Works of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Posted on Internet
articles.content:
Works of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il Posted on Internet 
						
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- The Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea on May 6 posted on its Internet website the full texts of President Kim Il Sung's work "On the Three Principles of National Reunification" and General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Our Socialism Centred on the Masses Shall Not Perish".
					 The President's work, published on May 3 and Nov. 3, Juche 61 (1972) clarifies the three principles of national reunification--independence, great national unity and peaceful reunification--and the idea of realizing cooperation between the north and the south of Korea.
					
					 The leader's work, published on May 5, Juche 80 (1991), deals with the inevitability of victory of socialism and the secret of solidity and invincibility of Korean socialism. It also comprehensively expounds that Korean socialism embodies the great Juche idea and it is the best socialist system providing the popular masses with an independent and creative life.

articles.title: Brisk Dissemination of Juche Idea Called for
articles.content:
Brisk Dissemination of Juche Idea Called for
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Organizations of Pakistan and Ukraine issued statements in support of the decision of the 13th enlarged meeting of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the International Institute of the Juche Idea.
					 The Pakistani Organization for the Study of the Juche Idea in a statement on May 5 said that it is the demand of the present situation to study and disseminate on a wide scale the Juche idea whose validity was verified in the struggle of the popular masses to win the substantial independence from tentacles of imperialism.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The Juche idea is the most powerful ideological weapon given to us by President Kim Il Sung who fought against all sorts of exploitation and oppression.
					
					 We will make every possible effort to disseminate the idea more widely and deeply among the popular masses, clearly aware of our responsibility.
					
					The Juche idea study organizations the world over will activate the study and dissemination of the Juche idea and thus make the world conference on the Juche idea a historic occasion of praising the undying feats of Kim Il Sung for the Korean revolution and the global independence and showing the fact that the revolutionary cause of Juche is successfully being carried forward by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The Ukrainian "Treasured Sword of Songun" Association for the Study of the Juche Idea said in a statement on May 6:
					
					 We think that the decision of the 13th enlarged meeting of the Executive Committee of the IIJI Board of Directors on convening a world conference on the Juche idea in Pyongyang on the Day of the Sun in 2012 gives pleasure to all the progressives of the world working to significantly commemorate the centenary of birth of Kim Il Sung with their boundless reverence for him.
					
					 The decision will also serve as a compass of action for most significantly commemorating the centenary of birth of the President in Ukraine.

articles.title: Earthquake Jolts Japan
articles.content:
Earthquake Jolts Japan
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 5.7 jolted Iwate Prefecture of Japan and its vicinity early Sunday, according to the Japan Meteorological Agency.
					 It was an apparent aftershock of the magnitude 9.0 quake of March 11, the agency said.

articles.title: 18th ASEAN Summit Held
articles.content:
18th ASEAN Summit Held
						
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- The 18th ASEAN Summit was held in Jakarta on May 7 and 8.
					 Attending there were state leaders and heads of government from 10 member countries of the organization.
					
					 The meeting discussed the issues of ensuring energy and food security, taking measures for preventing natural disaster, recovering economy, strengthening the position and role of ASEAN and other matters in international affairs.
					
					 The Summit concluded with the adoption of the three joint statements on the establishment of the ASEAN Institute for Peace and Reconciliation and cooperation against trafficking in persons and so on and the release of the Chair's Statement.

articles.title: Russian Prime Minister Proposes Forming Broad Popular Front
articles.content:
Russian Prime Minister Proposes Forming Broad Popular Front
 Moscow, May 9 (KCNA) -- Prime Minister Vladimir Putin who is leader of United Russia proposed creating a "broad popular front" when he was addressing a recent meeting of representatives of his party of a region. 
					 Putin said the new front should include not only United Russia but other political parties, trade unions, women's organizations, youth groups and veterans' associations.

articles.title: Russia Concerned about NATO's Plan to Deploy Missile Interceptors
articles.content:
Russia Concerned about NATO's Plan to Deploy Missile Interceptors 
 Moscow, May 9 (KCNA) -- Nikolai Makarov, chief of the General Staff of the Armed Forces of the Russian Federation, at a recent press conference, expressed deep concern about NATO's plan to deploy missile interceptors. 
					 As regards the plan of NATO to deploy missile interceptors close the Russian border, he charged that its move to deploy the European missile defence system was a breach of the agreement already reached. 
					
					 He urged NATO to give assurances that the above-said missile shield of Europe would not threaten Russia's nuclear potential.

articles.title: Damage by Forest Fire in Russia
articles.content:
Damage by Forest Fire in Russia
Moscow, May 9 (KCNA) -- Russia has recently suffered big damage from successive forest fire.
					 298 cases of forest fire occurred across the country on May 7 alone, burning more than 3,300 hectares of forests, the Ministry of Extraordinary Situation of Russia on the same day.
					
					 The extinguishment work was going on in afflicted areas.
					
					 It is reported that 4,200 cases of forest fire broke out in Russia in spring season of this year.

articles.title: War Victory Day Celebrated in Russia
articles.content:
War Victory Day Celebrated in Russia
						
 Moscow, May 9 (KCNA) -- The 66th anniversary of the victory in the Great Patriotic War was celebrated in Russia.
					 Russian President Dmitri Medvedev laid a wreath at the Tomb of the Unknown Soldier by the Wall of the Kremlin, Moscow on Sunday. 
					
					 Present at the wreath-laying ceremony were Prime Minister Vladimir Putin, members of the Federation Council and deputies to the State Duma, members of the Presidential Administration and the government, commanding officers of the army, war veterans, representatives of political parties and organizations and people from all walks of life.
					
					 An inaugural ceremony of the "Flag of Victory" Hall of the Central Museum of the Russian Armed Forces took place on the same day with the Russian president attending.
					
					 A military parade celebrating the 66th anniversary of the Great Patriotic War was held at Red Square in Moscow on Monday and a reception was given in Kremlin on the occasion.
					
					 That day meetings with war veterans, art performances, concerts and other colorful events took place in hero cities and many other cities and villages across the country and films on the theme of military patriotism were shown at cinema houses and aired by T.V. broadcasting services.

articles.title: China Rejects US Unilateral Measure
articles.content:
China Rejects US Unilateral Measure
 Beijing, May 9 (KCNA) -- Yaojian, spokesman for the Ministry of Commerce of China, recently released a statement assailing the unilateral measure taken by the United States against China.
					 The mission of Commerce of the U.S. in a report on the intellectual property rights included China in the "list of countries under observation".
					
					 China expresses regret over this measure, the spokesman said, stressing that the U.S. should make more overall, objective and fair appraisal of China's work on intellectual property rights.

articles.title: China to Establish State Internet Information Office
articles.content:
China to Establish State Internet Information Office 
						
Beijing, May 9 (KCNA) -- The General Office of the State Council of China recently issued a notice on the establishment of the State Internet Information Office.
					 The notice said that the main task of the office is to implement the line and politics on Internet information dissemination, give impetus to the institution of the law on the Internet information dissemination and lead and urge the relevant fields to strengthen the control over the contents of Internet information. 
					
					 The office will function under the Information Office of the State Council.

articles.title: Test Flight of Unmanned Helicopter Made in China
articles.content:
Test Flight of Unmanned Helicopter Made in China
						
 Beijing, May 9 (KCNA) -- The first test flight of the largest-ever unmanned helicopter V750 was conducted in Shandong Province, China on May 7.
					 This multi-purpose helicopter, made through remodeling of duo-piloted plane, can reportedly fly for more than four hours at speed of average 161 km an hour with all kinds of equipment loaded.
					
					 It is able to photograph and monitor fixed or moving targets in specified region and waters.

articles.title: Institution for Guidance of Special Zone of Talents Established in China
articles.content:
Institution for Guidance of Special Zone of Talents Established in China 
						
 Beijing, May 9 (KCNA) -- China recently established the Zhongguancun Guidance Commission for the Construction of Special Zone of Talents.
					 The commission is made up of 15 national institutions, ministries and commissions including the Commission for State Development and Reform, the Ministry of Education and the Ministry of Science and Technology and Beijing Municipality. Its purpose is to build the world's best special zone of talents by strengthening the guidance and unified coordination of the above-said construction.

articles.title: China, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan Conduct Joint Anti-Terror Drill
articles.content:
China, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan Conduct Joint Anti-Terror Drill
Beijing, May 9 (KCNA) -- China, Kyrgyzstan and Tajikistan, all member states of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO), Friday conducted a joint anti-terror drill in Xinjiang of China.
					 Code-named "Tianshan-II (2011)," the drill featured how law enforcers and security personnel from the three countries have coordinated efforts to locate and crack down on "terrorists" in the border regions.
					
					 The anti-terror exercise consisted of three parts, namely decision-making and command, freeing abductees by force, and cleanup operation at designated venues.
					
					 The drill is the second such joint anti-terrorism exercise that China's law enforcement bodies have participated in within SCO framework.

articles.title: US Padded Cost, Personnel for Relocating Marines to Guam
articles.content:
US Padded Cost, Personnel for Relocating Marines to Guam
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- It was disclosed recently that the U.S. deliberately padded the number of the marines to be relocated to Guam from Okinawa, sparking public furor. 
					 Tokyo Shimbun on May 5, quoting a diplomatic cable of the U.S. government, said that the U.S. padded the expense for the planned relocation of Marine troops to Guam from Okinawa and the number of personnel affected, in an attempt to make Japan's financial burden ratio outwardly smaller during the Japan-U.S. negotiations in 2006.

articles.title: Mozambique Calls for Exporting Finished Goods
articles.content:
Mozambique Calls for Exporting Finished Goods
						
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Mozambique's Minister of Mineral Resources Esperance Bias on Sunday stressed the need for the country to go in the direction of exporting finished goods.
					 The minister said that Mozambique must not eternally remain as an exporter of unprocessed minerals and other raw materials, but must advance to exporting finished goods.

articles.title: Bulgaria Celebrates Army Day
articles.content:
Bulgaria Celebrates Army 
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Bulgaria marked the Army Day.
					 A ceremony of placing a wreath before the tomb of the unknown soldier took place in Sofia on Friday. 
					
					 Present there were President Georgi Parvanov and high-ranking officials of the government. 
					
					 Then followed a military parade. 
					
					 The president in his speech made at the parade underscored the need for the army to get always ready as a guarantor of the country's sovereignty. 
					
					 Meanwhile, such diverse events as a concert and a ceremony of hoisting a national flag were held on the occasion.

articles.title: Landslide Damage in Indonesia
articles.content:
Landslide Damage in Indonesia
 Pyongyang, May 11 (KCNA) -- Heavy rains triggered landslide in West Java Province of Indonesia on May 7, causing damage.
					 The landslide left 17 persons dead, two missing and four wounded.
					
					 The rescuing work was being done on the spot.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun denuncia ambición expansionista de Japón
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun denuncia ambición expansionista de Japón
Pyongyang, 11 de mayo (ATCC) -- Hace poco, el periódico estadounidense Wall Street Journal insertó un mapa y artículo que anota correctamente el nombre del islote Tok y el Mar Este de Corea.
					Al respecto, el gobierno japonés formuló una protesta a la compañía Dow-Jones, que administra ese periódico, calificándolo de "imperdonable". 
					
					Tal alboroto es una pertinacia absurda. 
					
					Señala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual de este miércoles y continúa:
					
					Desde la antigüedad, el islote Tok es una parte del territorio coreano, y el mar entre Corea y Japón se ha llamado Mar Este de Corea. 
					
					Están anotados así no sólo en los registros históricos de Corea sino también en la mayoría de los mapas elaborados por los sabios de Europa y de Estados Unidos después de la Era Media.
					
					Esto conviene al principio y las costumbres internacionales sobre la posesión del territorio mostrenco y la anotación del nombre de mar.
					
					Sin embargo, el gobierno japonés protestó esta vez la utilización correcta del nombre del islote Tok y del Mar Este de Corea mostrando el cinismo y vicio propios de su país.
					
					El hecho evidencia que pasan el límite las maniobras de usurpación del territorio de los reaccionarios japoneses enloquecidos por la ambición militarista.
					
					La protesta del gobierno japonés es un proceder militarista muy asqueroso que parte del designio de dar a conocer a la sociedad internacional que el islote Tok es el territorio japonés y convertir el Mar Este de Corea en el "Mar de Japón". 
					
					Japón se desespera por arrebatar el islote Tok y el nombre del Mar Este de Corea menospreciando los datos históricos, las costumbres y principios internacionales sobre la posesión del territorio y la anotación del nombre de mar. Tales maniobras resultan una repetición y continuación de la agresión a Corea cometida en la primera mitad del siglo pasado por los imperialistas japoneses.
					
					El país isleño debe dejar de actuar imprudentemente, dándose clara cuenta de la época cambiada y de la opinión pública del mundo.

articles.title: EE.UU. se preocupa por dar a la publicidad el compromiso nuclear
articles.content:
EE.UU. se preocupa por dar a la publicidad el compromiso nuclear
Pyongyang, 11 de mayo (ATCC) -- Se ha revelado el hecho de que Estados Unidos volvió a expresar a Japón la preocupación por la publicación del compromiso secreto entre los dos países en el tema nuclear. 
					El periódico japonés Asahi Shimbun insertó el día 7 el siguiente artículo intitulado "Publicación de compromiso nuclear, nueva ´preocupación´ al poder del Partido Democrático":
					
					Según el análisis de un telegrama oficial diplomático referente a Japón, adquirido por WikiLeaks, el poder del Partido Democrático de Japón dio a la publicidad en marzo de 2010 el contenido del compromiso secreto entre Japón y EE.UU. en el tema nuclear acordado en 1960 en la enmienda del tratado de seguridad. Con respecto a esto, la parte norteamericana expresó reiteradamente la preocupación de que esto podría ejercer una influencia negativa a la estrategia de EE.UU. sobre el mundo. 
					
					Se consideraba que ese compromiso secreto, que permitió la entrada de buques norteamericanos cargados de armas nucleares en los puertos de Japón, perdió su vigencia en 1991, después del fin de la guerra fría, cuando las tropas norteamericanas dejaron de cargar armas nucleares en sus buques fluviales. 
					
					Pero, ese telegrama oficial aludió la intención de la parte norteamericana que se detenía en la continuación del "acuerdo silencioso" tomando en cuenta que habría un cambio en la política.
					
					Se cuestionarían inevitablemente las relaciones con los tres principios de desnuclearización de Japón que prohíbe la entrada de armas nucleares.
					
					Según el telegrama oficial remitido el 27 de noviembre de 2009 por la embajada estadounidense en Tokio al Departamento de Estado, ese día el ministro jefe y el jefe del departamento de América del Norte de la cancillería japonesa, Umemoto, discutieron en esta sede diplomática el problema de ese compromiso secreto. 
					
					El ministro jefe dijo que "la posición ambigua sobre la carga de armas nucleares en los buques es un elemento importante de la estrategia de disuasivo.
					
					El embajador Roos se preocupa por el rumbo de la investigación, que no es un simple problema nacional sino puede ejercer influencia negativa a la estrategia de EE.UU. en escala mundial". 
					
					Umemoto expresó consentimiento a esa preocupación de la parte norteamericana y respondió que "esto es un problema más difícil que el problema de la base militar de Futenma" y que "el poder actual de Hatoyama no se da cuenta de las consecuencias que emanará de la investigación del ´compromiso secreto´".
					
					Y agregó que "se necesita continuar las discusiones no oficiales entre Japón y EE.UU. sobre cómo responder a las voces que demandan explicaciones más claras sobre las armas nucleares".
					
					Dos meses después desde entonces, o sea, el 4 de febrero de 2010, un telegrama oficial procedente de Tokio reportó que ese tema se discutió también en las conversaciones entre el asistente del secretario de Estado para asuntos de Asia Oriental y el Pacífico, Campbell, y otros funcionarios norteamericanos y Umemoto y otros japoneses, sostenidas el mismo día. 
					
					Campbell presentó como la tarea de ambos países el "disuasivo de ampliación" y el "problema histórico sobre armas nucleares" y abogó por la necesidad de la "entrada de los aviones y buques de EE.UU. en Japón sin hacer caso de la carga de armas nucleares". 
					
					Los hechos muestran que el compromiso secreto entre EE.UU. y Japón en el tema nuclear no es un asunto surgido en estos momentos, sino es un problema de larga historia.

articles.title: Ryang Min Ho, especialista en mejoramiento de variedad de pepino
articles.content:
Ryang Min Ho, especialista en mejoramiento de variedad de pepino
						
Pyongyang, 11 de mayo (ATCC) -- Los pepinos lozanos, que crecen en el Invernadero de Cultivo Acuático del Instituto de Ciencia de Verduras de Pyongyang, acaparan la atención de los visitantes.
					Este pepino de alto rendimiento, mejorado por el jefe de la sección del citado instituto, Ryang Min Ho (de 49 años de edad), se resiste a la temperatura baja y las enfermedades y da frutos lozanos aun en las condiciones de baja insolación.
					
					También, Ryang produjo otra nueva variedad de pepino capaz de cultivar durante las cuatro estaciones.
					
					Además, obtuvo muchos éxitos en el estudio de variedades de verduras de alto rendimiento y nutritivas y recibió varios derechos de invención y certificados de nueva tecnología.
					
					En su reciente visita a dicho instituto, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il evaluó como patriotas a los científicos y técnicos de ahí, quienes marchan a pasos firmes a conquistar tecnologías de punta.

articles.title: Periódicos exhortan a ayudar a campo rural
articles.content:
Periódicos exhortan a ayudar a campo rural
						
Pyongyang, 11 de mayo (ATCC) -- Los periódicos centrales de Corea insertaron este miércoles sendos editoriales que llaman a dar ayuda potente al campo rural.
					El diario Rodong Sinmun destacó que todos deben movilizarse como un solo hombre en la lucha por terminar a tiempo conveniente y en lo cualitativo el transplante de posturas de arroz en acato al llamamiento del Partido de levantarse todo el partido, todo el país y todo el pueblo en la labor para la mejora de la vida del pueblo y continuó:
					
					Hoy en día, el Partido del Trabajo de Corea demanda que los trabajadores agrícolas registren grandes innovaciones y saltos en la producción agrícola siguiendo el espíritu e ímpetu de lucha de las generaciones anteriores.
					
					No habrá ninguna cosa imposible en el mundo si trabajamos con el indoblegable espíritu de lucha del pueblo de la zona guerrillera de Xiaowangqing, quienes enviaron las provisiones a la guerrilla cultivando las tierras y sembrando las semillas en los tiempos de la lucha ensangrentada antijaponesa.
					
					Debemos crear milagros e innovaciones en el trasplante de posturas de arroz de este año siguiendo el temperamento de lucha de los agricultores patrióticos quienes en los días de la Guerra de Liberación de la Patria aseguraron la producción de cereales enarbolando la consigna "También la retaguardia es frente". Hay que producir la innovación colectiva en esa faena agrícola ayudándose uno a otro bajo la consigna "¡Uno para todos y todos para uno!"
					
					Todos los sectores y las unidades de la economía nacional deben asegurar primordial e incondicionalmente la mano de obra, los equipos y los materiales necesarios al trasplante de posturas de arroz adhiriéndose al principio de subordinar lo todo a la agricultura.
					
					A su vez, el periódico Minju Joson subrayó la necesidad de concentrar y movilizar todas las fuerzas a la ayuda al campo rural para registrar grandes innovaciones en la producción agrícola del año en curso bajo la dirección del Songun del PTC.
